main event: A bright object observed in the sky over Hamilton and Cleves, Ohio on March 13, 1955.
interesting points: The object was brighter than the sky and silent, resembling a star before it approached at high speed., The object ascended almost straight up at a very high rate of speed., Witness estimates the object was about 500 to 1000 mph., The sighting lasted for approximately 3 minutes and was witnessed by an air traffic controller and a plumber., No exhaust flame or sound was noted during the sighting.
